intro: Rondeletia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Rondeletia mexicana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
